Michigan Initial Health & Safety Training Module B
Section 1: Child Development

Developmental Milestones: 3 - 12 Years

  1. 3 Years:

    Social/Emotional

    • takes turns at games
    • shows concern for crying friend
    • dresses and undresses self

    Language/
    Communication

    • follows 2-3 step instructions
    • understands “on”, ”in”, & ”under”
    • talks well enough for stranger to understand most of the time

    Cognitive/Thinking

    • does 3 or 4-piece puzzles
    • copies circle with pencil or crayon
    • screws jar lid or turns door handle

    Movement/Physical

    • walks up & down stairs
    • one foot on each step
    • climbs well, runs easily

  2. 4-6 Years:

    Social/Emotional

    • starts to notice how other children act
    • begins learning how to make and keep friends

    Language/
    Communication

    • talks in long sentences and talks a lot

    Cognitive/Thinking

    • begins to look for logical answers to their questions
    • uses imagination

    Movement/Physical

    • can typically hop, skip, jump and dance
    • can copy shapes and letters

  3. 7-9 Years:

    Social/Emotional

    • starts narrowing down to a few good friends
    • easily influenced by their peers

    Language/
    Communication

    • better at using language to express emotions and ideas

    Cognitive/Thinking

    • starts understanding more complicated ideas
    • like cause and effect

    Movement/Physical

    • fine motor becomes more controlled and physical stamina improves

  4. 10-12 Years:

    Social/Emotional

    • develops the ability to understand different points of view
    • increasing interest in time with friends

    Language/
    Communication

    • starts communicating more with posture, tone of voice, and body language

    Cognitive/Thinking

    • able to think about abstract ideas

    Movement/Physical

    • good eye/hand coordination
    • starts showing signs of puberty
